heading: nortel leads voice-data alliance
subheading: intel, microsoft, and hewlett-packard reportedly will join with the canadian company in an initiative aiming for single-line communications.
author: wired news report
text: nortel networks, along with three computer industry giants, will announce plans to build corporate networking equipment that can handle data, voice, and video communications. nortel set a press conference for monday morning in san jose, california, and listed chief executives john roth of nortel (nt), bill gates of microsoft (msft), craig barrett of intel (intc), and lewis platt of hewlett-packard (hwp) as participants.according to a report in the financial times, the envisioned network would use intel's pentium iii chips and microsoft's windows nt. nortel would build the equipment and hp would market the new products under its name.the products could enable corporations to build a single network to carry their internal phone calls and computer data, theoretically resulting in much lower communications costs.reuters contributed to this report.
